When disabled (false) or omitted, the default behavior throws an exception if the match is not found in Goracle.

422.description: 422 One or more of the query params are invalid. The response body will contain more info.

429.description: 429 Requests are being sent too frequently - the request was throttled.

get.description: Returns random props (outcomes) from Goracle for a specific sport. Used by Pluto to display daily props.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of random props to return

get.description: Returns a single random prop. Used by admins to swap individual props.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of random props to return

get.description: Returns paired player props (over/under) ready for client consumption. Goracle returns all available outcomes; Khronos applies comprehensive filtering: Excludes h2h, spreads, totals, team_totals, and anytime touchdown markets. Groups outcomes into Over/Under pairs. Applies minimum odds filter (>= -150 American odds). Limits to 1-2 props per event for variety. Each returned object contains both over and under outcomes in a denormalized structure. No pairing logic needed on client side - each prop is self-contained.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of random props to return

get.summary: Get paired player props ready for predictions

get.description: Returns ALL available props for caching purposes. No random sampling, no count limit. Used by Pluto to cache all available props for autocomplete functionality.
get.summary: Get all available props for a sport (no count limit)

get.description: Returns a prop from Goracle by its market_id or outcome_uuid. Market ID groups related outcomes together (e.g., Over/Under pairs share the same market_id). If market_id is provided, the system queries predictions to find an associated outcome_uuid, then fetches the full market details from Goracle. If outcome_uuid is provided, it fetches directly. Either market_id or outcome_uuid must be provided. Response contains all outcomes in the market along with event context information.

parameters.name: market_id
parameters.description: Market ID from Goracle - used to retrieve a prop by its market identifier. All outcomes in a market share the same market_id. If provided, the system queries predictions to find an associated outcome_uuid, then fetches the full market details.

parameters.name: outcome_uuid
parameters.description: Outcome UUID from Goracle - used to retrieve a prop by its outcome identifier. Can be used as an alternative to market_id. Either market_id or outcome_uuid must be provided.

400.description: Invalid request parameters - neither market_id nor outcome_uuid provided

404.description: Prop not found - either no predictions exist for the market_id, or outcome_uuid not found in Goracle

get.summary: Get a prop by market ID or outcome UUID

post.description: Allows staff to manually set the result of a prop (outcome), triggering prediction processing and leaderboard updates. The propId is the outcome_uuid from Goracle.

200.description: Prop result set successfully, predictions processed

post.summary: Manually set prop result

info.title: Khronos API Documentation
info.description: Khronos is a sports-focused API that integrates with my other app, Pluto for Discord.

message.example: Bad Request

description.description: Outcome description - typically the player name for player props (e.g., "Patrick Mahomes"). Undefined for team markets like spreads/totals.

name.description: Outcome name - team name for h2h/spreads markets (e.g., "Los Angeles Lakers"), or outcome choice for totals/props (e.g., "Over", "Under", "Yes", "No")

outcome_type.description: Outcome type categorization: OVER, UNDER, TEAM_HOME, TEAM_AWAY, YES, NO

status.description: Reflects the status of prop/outcome or match - typically "completed" for final scores, "in_progress" for ongoing games, or "scheduled" for future events. `result` being present is a more valid indicator of completion

bookmakers.description: All bookmakers and their markets for this match

status.description: Match status. Possible values: scheduled, in_progress, complete, cancelled, postponed

winner.description: Winning team name (only for completed matches)

message.example: Successfully fetched matchup info.

matches.description: List of all matches from Goracle across all supported sports
List of matches for the specified sport from Goracle

guild_id.description: The unique identifier for the guild

setting_type.description: The type of setting for the Discord configuration

setting_value.description: The value associated with the setting

id.description: Unique identifier for the Discord configuration entry

guild_id.description: Guild ID associated with the setting

setting_value.description: Value of the setting. When the setting type is 'preferred_teams', it is a comma separated list. E.g, 'lakers,hawks'

message.default: All channels have been removed successfully

id.description: Unique identifier for the Discord configuration entry

guild_id.description: Guild ID associated with the setting

setting_value.description: Value of the setting. When the setting type is 'preferred_teams', it is a comma separated list. E.g, 'lakers,hawks'

config.description: Discord configurations associated with the guild

adminUserId.description: Optional admin user ID for audit trail

forceSettlement.description: If true, forces settlement even if the event was already processed. Use to fix "zombie" events where bets remain pending despite settlement. Corresponds to forceSettlement in manualSettleMatchSchema.

tie.description: Indicates if the match ended in a tie

message.example: Match settled successfully

matchIds.description: Array of match IDs to reconcile

forceSettlement.description: If true, upserts the settlement record even if it exists. Use to fix "zombie" events where bets remain pending despite settlement.

betid.description: The unique identifier for the betslip

userid.description: The user ID associated with the betslip

team.description: The team/player chosen in the bet

profit.description: The profit from the bet, if applicable

payout.description: The total payout from the bet, if applicable

guild_id.description: The Discord guild ID associated with the betslip

isNewUser.description: Flag indicating if this is a newly created account

userid.description: The ID of the user placing the bet

team.description: The name of the team (or, player, etc) the user is betting on

amount.description: The amount the user is betting

guild_id.description: The guild id - The origin of where the bet was placed

matchup_id.description: The Identifier for a match. This is & must be provided if there's multiple matches for the team, and the user submits the specific match they want to bet on.

market_key.description: The market key for the bet

event_id.description: The event ID from the source API

userid.description: The user ID associated with the betslip

team.description: The team (or player) chosen in the bet

profit.description: The profit from the bet, if applicable

payout.description: The total payout from the bet, if applicable

opponent.description: Opposing team in the match the user has bet on

dateofmatchup.description: Date of the match the user has bet on

isNewUser.description: Flag indicating if this is a newly created account

betslip.description: The data containing finalized betslip details -- This is sent back to the client (Pluto) for the user to confirm their betslip

guild_id.description: The guild id - The origin of where the bet was placed

matchup_id.description: The Identifier for a match. // aka event_id

market_key.description: The prop type the match & bet belongs to.

message.example: Successfully cleared pending betslip.
Successfully closed bets.

newBalance.description: The new balance after the bet amount change

payout.description: The total payout after the bet amount change

profit.description: The profit from the bet amount change

message.example: Bet amount changed successfully. New balance: 800

modified.description: Details of the modifications including new balance, profit, and payout

newBetAmount.description: The new amount of the bet after doubling.

newProfit.description: The profit expected if the bet wins, calculated based on the doubled bet amount.

newPayout.description: The total potential payout (original bet plus profit) if the bet wins.

newBalance.description: The new balance of the users account after the bet amount has been doubled and deducted.

userid.description: The unique identifier of the user who owns the bet.

betId.description: The unique identifier of the bet that has been doubled.

isNewUser.description: Flag indicating if this is a newly created account

status.description: The HTTP status code of the response.

message.example: Bet amount doubled successfully.
message.description: A message detailing the result of the operation.

betslip.description: The detailed information about the doubled betslip.

patreonOverride.description: Indicates if the Patreon override is enabled, which means the user is a Patreon member and in some cases, meets the required Patreon tier.

message.example: Successfully deleted betslip.

betIds.description: Array of bet IDs to refund

message.example: Successfully refunded 3 pending bets

id.description: Unique identifier for the money record

isNewUser.description: Whether the user is new or not. This is flagged within the service if an account has to be created for them.

patreonOverride.description: Indicates if the Patreon override is enabled, which means the user is a Patreon member and in some cases, meets the required Patreon tier.

id.description: The unique identifier of the leaderboard entry

balance.description: The balance associated with the leaderboard entry

outcome_uuid.description: Unique identifier for the outcome in Goracle

event_id.description: Event ID from Goracle - corresponds 1:1 with our database match IDs

result.description: Outcome-specific result indicating if this particular outcome won, lost, pushed, or was cancelled. Values: "win", "loss", "push", "cancelled"

actual_value.description: The actual numeric value that determined the result. Examples: Final score for moneyline (108), Total points for Over/Under (215.5), Point differential for spread (7), Total touchdowns, etc. Primarily used for player props.

correlation_id.description: Correlation ID for tracking webhook across systems

completed_at.description: Timestamp when the outcome was completed

winner.description: The winning team name (e.g., "Los Angeles Lakers") or "Draw" for ties

correlation_id.description: Correlation ID for tracking this webhook through the system

note.description: Optional note about processing (e.g., duplicate detection)

status.description: Health status of the webhook endpoint

key.description: The unique key for the market
The unique key for the bookmaker

id.description: The unique identifier for the odds/match

choice.description: (Optional) Who or what the user is betting/predicting on. If not provided, will be derived from Goracle outcome data.

market_id.description: Market ID from Goracle - used for grouping paired outcomes

predictions.description: Array of predictions for this event

outcome_uuid.description: Primary outcome UUID (prop ID) - used for display/formatter compatibility. For markets with market_id, this is one of the UUIDs in outcome_uuids.

market_id.description: Market ID from Goracle - groups related outcomes together (e.g., Over/Under pairs share the same market_id). Null for legacy data.

outcome_uuids.description: Array of all outcome UUIDs in this market. For markets with market_id, contains all outcomes (e.g., Over and Under). For legacy data without market_id, contains only the primary outcome_uuid.

description.description: Prop description (e.g., player name for player props)

prediction_count.description: Total number of pending predictions on this prop

props.description: List of props for this game, sorted by prediction count DESC

games.description: List of games on this date, sorted by total prediction count DESC

market_id.description: Market ID from Goracle - used for grouping paired outcomes (Over/Under, Yes/No)

week_number.description: Week number relative to the system start

id.description: Unique identifier for the processing record

processed_at.description: Timestamp of when the prediction was processed

status.description: Status of the processing. New records default to IN_PROGRESS

details.description: Any additional processing details or metadata

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the record was created

updated_at.description: Timestamp of when the record was last updated

market_id.description: Market ID from Goracle - used for grouping paired outcomes (Over/Under, Yes/No)

week_number.description: Week number relative to the system start

market_id.description: Market ID from Goracle - used for grouping paired outcomes

sport.description: The sport associated with this season week

weekNumber.description: The week number in the season

entries.description: Array of leaderboard entries ranked by success rate

total_users.description: Total number of users in the leaderboard

count.description: The number of bets for the team

losses.description: The number of losses for the team

id.description: Unique identifier for the leaderboard entry

name.description: Outcome name (e.g., Over, Under, Yes, No, team name for spreads)

outcome_type.description: Outcome type categorization: OVER, UNDER, TEAM_HOME, TEAM_AWAY, YES, NO

description.description: Outcome description - typically the player name for player props (e.g., "Patrick Mahomes"). Null for team markets like spreads/totals.

market_id.description: Market ID from Goracle - groups related outcomes together (e.g., Over/Under pairs share the same market_id)
Market ID from Goracle - groups related outcomes together (e.g., Over/Under pairs share the same market_id). Null for legacy data.

outcomes.description: All possible outcomes for this market (Over/Under, Yes/No, team options for spreads, etc.). Each outcome is a bettable "prop". For player props, all outcomes share the same player name in their description field.

winner.description: The winning result/choice for the prop

status.description: Status of the prop after setting result

user_id.description: Discord user ID of the admin setting the result

title.description: Title or summary of the update

content.description: Detailed description/content of the update (Markdown supported)

text.example: Made with love by the dev team

category.description: Category for the footer. Null if announcement.

isAnnouncement.description: If true, this footer overrides all others when active

expiresAt.description: Expiration date for the footer (ISO 8601). Footer will be auto-filtered after this date.
